articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Banquet for Those from South Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Banquet for Those from South Hamgyong Province

					Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, gave a banquet for officials, labor innovators, scientists and technicians of South Hamgyong Province.
					
					Present there on invitation were officials, labor innovators, scientists and technicians from South Hamgyong Province including those from the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex, the Hungnam Smeltery, the Taehung Youth Hero Mine, the Ryongyang Mine, the Tanchon Magnesia Factory, the Tanchon Port construction site, the Ryongjon Fruit Farm, the Tongbong Co-op Farm of Hamju County.
					
					Kim Jong Il warmly congratulated them on their laudable successes made in the efforts to make a breakthrough towards the fulfillment of the national economy plan and consolidate the nation's economic foundation. 
					
					Pak To Chun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, made a speech at the banquet.
					
					He said that it was Kim Jong Il who worked out plans and worked heart and soul to lead the province to technologically update the factories and enterprises which were in no better shape than debris and push back the frontiers of latest science and technology but commended its officials, workers, scientists and technicians for those feats. 
					
					You are the most privileged in the world to receive such profound solicitude from the leader and such legendary loving care and happiness can be enjoyed only by his soldiers, he added.
					
					The participants in the banquet renewed their firm determination to carry through the intentions of the Party by developing the high-pitched labor drive that raged in South Hamgyong Province into a dynamic drive for building a thriving nation and making it serve as a banner of victory for bringing about a greater surge in the nationwide march towards 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Present at the banquet were senior officials of the party and armed forces organs Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk and other members of the Political Bureau and members of the WPK Central Committee and Central Military Commission and officials of the NDC and armed forces organs.

articles.title: Vice-Premier of China Arrives in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Vice-Premier of China Arrives in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, arrived in Pyongyang by air on Sunday to pay an official goodwill visit to the DPRK at the invitation of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government.
					
					 Accompanying him were You Quan, deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Yuan, managing director of the China Development Bank, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, Liu Tienan, deputy head of the National Development and Reform Committee, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, Ning Jizhe, deputy director of the Policy Research Office of the State Council, and other suite members.
					
					 They were met at the airport by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Kim Song Gi, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 Also present there were Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-Premier's Written Address on Arrival in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-Premier's Written Address on Arrival in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, made public a written address on his arrival in Pyongyang at the airport on Sunday.
					
					 The Korean people have made laudable achievements in socialist revolution and construction in the spirit of self-reliance and strenuous efforts under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he said, adding that he was very pleased with this.
					
					 He continued:
					
					 It is the invariable policy of the Chinese party and government to constantly develop the traditional friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 We hope that our exchange and cooperation with the DPRK side will be constantly deepened in all sectors, thus bringing greater happiness to the two peoples. 
					
					 The Chinese side praises the DPRK side for taking such active actions in various aspects as improving its relations with south Korea and the United States and giving impetus to the resumption of the six-party talks. And it will continue to play its constructive role and make a positive contribution to promoting the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and defending peace, stability and development of this region together with all parties concerned.
					
					 I will make candid and in-depth exchanges of views over the matters of mutual concern with senior officials of the party and state of the DPRK.
					
					 I believe this visit will provide an opportunity for further strengthening the traditional friendship between the two parties, governments and peoples, boosting bilateral exchange and cooperation in all fields and encouraging the development of the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Meets Chinese Vice-Premier
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Meets Chinese Vice-Premier

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday.
					
					 Present there were You Quan, deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Yuan, managing director of the China Development Bank, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, Liu Tienan, deputy head of the National Development and Reform Committee, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, Ning Jizhe,deputy director of the Policy Research Office of the State Council, and other suite members.
					
					 Also present there were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet who doubles chairman of the State Planning Commission, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, Kim Song Gi, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Yong Sok, deputy director of the Secretariat of the Cabinet, and officials concerned. 
					
					 Li Keqiang said a series of visits paid by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to China put the relations between the two parties and states on a new higher stage.
					
					 It is the steadfast stand of the party and government of China to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK, Li said, expressing his intention to boost exchange and cooperation with it.
					
					 He recalled that General Secretary Hu Jintao courteously invited Kim Jong Il to visit China.
					
					 He wished the Korean people greater success in the efforts to build a thriving nation under the leadership of the WPK led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-Premier Feted
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-Premier Feted

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government gave a banquet in honor of Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK at the People's Palace of Culture on Sunday.
					
					 Present there on invitation were You Quan, deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Yuan, managing director of the China Development Bank, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, Liu Tienan, deputy head of the National Development and Reform Committee, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, Ning Jizhe, deputy director of the Policy Research Office of the State Council, and other suite members and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol who doubles chairman of the State Planning Commission, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, Kim Song Gi, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Yong Sok, deputy director of the Secretariat of the Cabinet, and officials concerned were on hand. 
					
					  Ro Tu Chol said in his speech at the banquet that the DPRK-China friendship is developing vigorously on a new higher stage under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 The top leaders of the two countries, at their historic meetings and talks held several times, promised to develop the traditional DPRK-China friendship generation after generation, thus providing a new milestone for the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation, he said.
					
					 It is the fixed stand of the WPK and the DPRK government to develop the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations steadily in an all-round way, he declared.
					
					 We, together with Chinese comrades, will do best to further strengthen the unbreakable unity and sincere cooperation and preserve the regional peace and stability by joint efforts. 
					
					 Li Keqiang said in his speech that the Korean people have worked hard to build a thriving nation under the leadership of the WPK led by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He sincerely wished the fraternal Korean people greater success in various fields.
					
					 The party and government of China attach utmost importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship which stood the test of history and greatly set store by it, he added.
					
					 He expressed the will to join the Korean comrades in consolidating and steadily developing the friendly and cooperative relations onto a new stage in the spirit of the agreement reached between the top leaders of the two countries on the basis of "inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation."

articles.title: Agreement on DPRK-China Economic and Technological Cooperation Signed
articles.content:
Agreement on DPRK-China Economic and Technological Cooperation Signed

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Several agreed documents between governments of the DPRK and China, including an agreement on economic and technological cooperation, were signed with due ceremony in Pyongyang Sunday.
					
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ku Pon Thae, Vice-Chairman of the Commission for Joint Venture and Investment Jong Jinsong, Ri Yong Sok, deputy director of the Secretariat of the Cabinet, and officials concerned.
					
					 On hand from the Chinese side were Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, Wang Zhilin, economic and commercial councilor of the Chinese embassy and others concerned. 
					
					 The documents were inked by Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Jong Jin Song, vice chairman of the Joint Venture Investment Committee, upon authorization of the DPRK government and Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce upon authorization of the Chinese government.

articles.title: Sino-DPRK Cooperation Will Grow Stronger: Chinese Official
articles.content:
Sino-DPRK Cooperation Will Grow Stronger: Chinese Official

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Deputy Administrator Yu Xinwen of the China Meteorological Administration had an interview with journalists in Pyongyang on Friday during his visit to the DPRK.
					
					 The traditional Sino-DPRK friendly relations are developing with each passing day, he said, and went on:
					
					 The scientific and technological exchange and cooperation in meteorology have long developed between the two countries. 
					
					 This is unthinkable without the friendly relations between the two countries. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited China several times this year to exchange in-depth views with General Secretary Hu Jintao before reaching an important agreement. 
					
					 Exchange and cooperation in meteorology between the two countries have further developed in recent years. 
					
					 The meteorological work is closely related to the development of economy and the improvement of people's living standard. 
					
					 I am sure that the cooperation between the two countries will grow stronger.
					
					 We were deeply moved to witness the Korean people's struggle, Yu said, adding: 
					
					 We hope that the Korean people would make long strides in the drive to achieve economic progress and improve the people's living standard. 
					
					 We will steadily boost exchange and cooperation with the State Hydro-Meteorological Administration of the DPRK and thus actively contribute to promoting the development of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations.

articles.title: Russian Governor Expresses Will to Boost Cooperation with DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Governor Expresses Will to Boost Cooperation with DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Oleg Kozhemyako, governor of Amur Region of the Russian Federation, gave his impressions of the recent visit to the DPRK. 
					
					 He said:
					
					 We visited the DPRK at the time when the Russia-DPRK relations are growing stronger. 
					
					 This visit took place under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I extend sincere thanks to him. 
					
					 During the stay we received cordial hospitality from the Korean people wherever we went. Through it, we deeply felt the Korean people's friendship toward the Russian people. 
					
					 The meeting between President Dmitri Medvedev and leader Kim Jong Il made a great contribution to developing the friendly relations between the two countries. 
					
					 We saw the courageous and diligent Korean people working hard, the governor noted, saying: 
					
					 All work going on in the DPRK is for making the living of the people richer.
					
					 Amur Region will further strengthen exchange and cooperation with the DPRK in different fields. 
					
					 This will be conducive to development of the Russia-DPRK friendly relations. 
					
					 We hope that the heroic Korean people will achieve bigger success in developing the economy and improving the people's living standard under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: National Unity Is Key to Peace and Reunification-Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
National Unity Is Key to Peace and Reunification--Rodong Sinmun

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration, in its recent appeal marking the 4th anniversary of the October 4 declaration, called upon the people from all walks of life at home and abroad to promote the national unity under the banner of the north-south joint declarations. 
					
					 Recalling this fact, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a bylined article:
					
					 The appeal gives all Koreans the faith in the independent reunification, peace and prosperity, arousing them to the grand nationwide march for independent reunification.
					
					 The national reunification is an undertaking to terminate the foreign forces' domination and interference, completely realize the sovereignty of the nation, remove the distrust and contradiction between the north and the south and achieve national unity.
					
					 A key problem in realizing national reunification will be smoothly settled if the north and the south get harmony with each other and all Koreans pool their will and efforts to achieve great national unity. 
					
					 National reunification is an independent cause involving all Koreans that can be realized by their concerted efforts.
					
					 It is none other than the Korean nation that wants its reunification. It is also the Korean nation that should carry out this historic task and will enjoy benefit from national reunification.
					
					 To achieve the national unity is an urgent demand for preserving peace of the country and steadily advancing the June 15 era.
					
					 All Koreans should take concerted action and join hands for the nation's great cause, irrespective of class and strata, affiliation and ism.
					
					 Nothing can match the strength of the united nation and no force can check the advance of the reunification movement by all Koreans closely rallied under the banner of national independence and patriotism.

articles.title: Brainwash for Confrontation Intensified in S. Korean Army
articles.content:
Brainwash for Confrontation Intensified in S. Korean Army

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military authorities nowadays intensify the brainwash campaign for confrontation among compatriots at the military units in the forefront, displaying videos of insult to the south Korean people's anti-U.S. struggle for independence and reunification movement.
					
					 This video distorts the Popular Uprising on Jeju Island, the case of the People's Revolutionary Party, the torchlight action in 2008 and other cases as ones agitated by "pro-north forces". It is a propaganda footage invented by the warmongers in a bid to drive the army to the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 In the early days of his office the present chief executive of south Korea claimed that it is more important to raise security awareness than to update the army. He also made rounds of military units deployed in such areas standing in acute confrontation with the DPRK as Paekryong Island to incite showdown consciousness.
					
					 Military bosses, too, toured frontline units in south Korean Kangwon and Kyonggi provinces and islands in the West Sea of Korea, inciting hostility towards the compatriots.
					
					 The military warmongers decided to set up again at the defence school a mental education institution run in the period of the past dictatorial regime and reformed the behavioral science institute into a mental power and action science institute.
					
					 They added contents of putting the blame for the June 25 War on the DPRK to textbooks for mental education and distributed these wholly reformed books to the military units.
					
					 "Security park" was set up at every military stationary place to conduct brainwash with antagonism toward the DPRK.
					
					 Former and incumbent chiefs of the puppet army general staff slandered the DPRK as "direct and serious threat" and "principal enemy", and the DPRK was specified as "principal enemy" in south Korea's "2010 report on the army policy" and "white paper on defence".
					
					 Meanwhile, mental education is being intensified at every military academy and unit to implant the "steadfast view on enemy" into cadets and servicepersons.
					
					 The military units of south Korea make it a rule to chant what are called oath and resolution carrying phrases "Our enemy is the north's army" and implant the "view on enemy" in officers and soldiers before going on training and guard duty.
					
					 Slogan boards and posters specifying the DPRK as "enemy" are displayed everywhere the servicepersons exist. Firing targets and to-be-occupied hypothetical areas in military training are marked with what symbolizes the DPRK.
					
					 The warmongers have made such provocations as writing or hanging up the slogans and placards of slanders to the system and the army of the DPRK in many barracks, posts and military installations of the forefront units and on road signs and fences in their vicinity.
					
					 Their reckless moves for confrontation with the compatriots will surely face a stern punishment by history.

articles.title: Japanese Call for Intensified Campaign for Normalizing DPRK-Japan Relations
articles.content:
Japanese Call for Intensified Campaign for Normalizing DPRK-Japan Relations

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The 35th national meeting for interchange to deepen the Japan-DPRK friendship took place in Fukuoka Prefecture of Japan on Oct. 1 and 2.
					
					 Present there were personages of the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange, Liaison Council of the Society for the Study of the Juche Idea of Japanese Teachers, Japan Teachers' Union and the Fukuoka Teachers Union, friendly teachers and members of civic and public organizations from across Japan and officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Speeches were made by the chairman of the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange, the president of the Liaison Council of the Society for the Study of the Juche Idea of Japanese Teachers and the president of the Fukuoka Teachers Union.
					
					 They noted that a dynamic campaign has been conducted to urge the application of the tuition waiver program for senior high schools to the Korean schools in Japan.
					
					 They called for intensified campaign to realize the Japan-DPRK diplomatic relations according to the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 Then followed a keynote report.
					
					 The reporter recalled that the national meeting for interchange has played an important role in the movement to inform the Japanese of true reality of the DPRK and deepen the friendship between two countries, and advanced the future task facing the meeting.
					
					 The meeting adopted a resolution on intensifying the movement to urge the Japanese government to promptly apply the aid program to the Korean schools, resume inter-governmental dialogue between Japan and the DPRK and realize the bilateral diplomatic relations by 2012.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked in Japan
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked in Japan

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Korean youth and students in Japan met in Tokyo on October 6 to mark the 4th anniversary of the historic October 4 declaration.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, Pak Tong Ho, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Students in Japan, Mun Se Hyon, chairman of the south Korean Youth League in Japan, league officials in Kanto and students of Joson University.
					
					 A reporter and speakers at the meeting recalled that Korean youth and students in Japan have waged the vigorous movement for national reunification under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration over the past years.
					
					 It is important to remove every obstacle lying in the way of national reconciliation and unity and reunify the country at an early date, they held, calling on all the Korean youth and students in Japan to play the vanguard role in the nationwide struggle for implementing the inter-Korean declarations.
					
					 Then, the participants watched a video dealing with the signal events made in the national reunification movement since the publication of the above-said declarations and the Korean's desire for reunification.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Oct. 6 and 12 to mark the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union. They included meetings, film shows and photo exhibitions in Laos, Kyrgyzstan and Peru.
					
					 On display in the exhibition halls were photos on the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il for party building.
					
					 Korean films shown included "The Korean People's Army, Steel-Strong Ranks".
					
					 The chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association said that Kim Il Sung founded the WPK and made signal successes by wisely leading the Korean revolution and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 Under the guidance of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il the WPK developed into a party solid and strong in organizational and ideological aspects and firmly adhered to the socialist idea, he said.
					
					 The WPK has won victory after victory because it thoroughly applied the Juche idea, founded by the President, in all fields and adhered to the principle of independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence, he noted.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan said that the formation of the DIU by the President on Oct. 17, 1926, was a historic event of great significance in the development of the Korean revolution. The Korean revolution which started with the DIU has dynamically advanced along the road of independence, Songun and unity, he added.
					
					 Only victory and glory are always in store for socialist Korea as Kim Jong Il leads the Korean revolution, he stressed.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting held in Peru.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Foreign Newspapers 

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups with photos of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il to mark the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 Articles praising the WPK were run in Lao papers Pasason, Vatelao, Vientiane Mai and Congtap Pasason Lao on October 10 and the Oct. 1-15 issue of Noum Lao and the Sept. 16-30 issue of Heng Ngan of this country. 
					
					 They said the DPRK is working miracles of history in building a thriving nation under the worst adversity. The world clearly sees in this reality the truth that the Songun politics of the WPK is a treasured sword of invincibility for accomplishing the socialist cause, and the WPK under the leadership of Kim Jong Il will always emerge victorious, they stressed. 
					
					 The Indian paper Defense and Humanity on Oct. 10 carried an article titled "Founder of WPK", which said that the WPK has led to victory the building of new society, the construction of socialism centered on the popular masses with the Juche idea created by Kim Il Sung as guideline. The President's exploits will shine long with the invincible dignity of the WPK, it added. 
					
					 On the same day the Czech paper Halo Noviny carried an article titled "Founding Anniversary of WPK", which said the goal and activities of the WPK enjoy the absolute support from the Korean people. 
					
					 Under the guidance of the WPK, the DPRK achieved the single-minded unity of whole society and its army is defending the country while taking active part in socialist construction, the paper stressed.

articles.title: Anniversary of DIU Marked in Mexico and Cambodia
articles.content:
Anniversary of DIU Marked in Mexico and Cambodia 

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Mexican newspaper and Cambodian radio observed the 85th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU). 
					
					 The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on Oct. 15 ran an article titled "85th Anniversary of DIU", which said that the Korean revolution which started with the DIU under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung has dynamically advanced along the road of independence, Songun and unity over the past 85 years. 
					
					 Independence is the main principle and stand of the Korean revolution set forth by the DIU, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung strictly adhered to the idea and principle of independence in the whole course of leading the Korean revolution. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il has led the WPK to conduct its activities in an independent and creative way with the Juche idea as its guideline by creditably carrying forward the cause of Kim Il Sung, thus making the Korean people always win victories in accomplishing the socialist cause. 
					
					 Songun is the invariable banner of the Korean revolution that most thoroughly embodied the DIU's idea of anti-imperialist struggle. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il has pursued the Songun politics by successfully inheriting the Songun idea and line of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 This politics is a sure guarantee helping the DPRK win victory despite all difficulties century after century. 
					
					 Unity is the mainstay of the Korean revolution. The DIU regarded it as philosophy of invincibility. 
					
					 Victory and glory are always in store for socialist Korea, dignified with independence, powerful with Songun policy and invincible with single-minded unity. 
					
					 The paper also ran a photo of the Party Founding Memorial Tower. 
					
					 The Cambodian Apsara TV and Sound Broadcasting on Oct. 15 stressed that the Korean revolution would continue to emerge victorious under the guidance of the WPK which inherited the tradition of DIU.

articles.title: Chinese Paper on Development of Sino-DPRK Relations
articles.content:
Chinese Paper on Development of Sino-DPRK Relations 

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The Chinese newspaper People's Daily on Oct. 20 carried an article titled "China and DPRK record a new chapter of friendship". 
					
					 The good-neighborly friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have steadily developed, standing the trials of complicated world situation, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 This year is an important year in the history of Sino-DPRK friendly relationship as it marks the 50th anniversary of the China-DPRK treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance. Exchange and cooperation between the two countries have developed in depth in various fields including politics, economy and culture. 
					
					 In recent years the two countries have strengthened visits and steadily deepened mutual strategic understandings. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il, supreme leader of the DPRK, visited China four times in a little more than one year lately. He met with General Secretary Hu Jintao to exchange views on bilateral relations and matters of mutual concern and reach an important common understanding on a series of matters. This showed the orientation of developing the China-DPRK relations and injected great vitality in these relations. 
					
					 Now the two countries are sincerely implementing the important common understanding achieved by their leaders and steadily boosting the friendly exchange and cooperation in various fields while continuing to develop the bilateral relations. 
					
					 Bilateral cooperation in economy and trade is gaining in scope and exchange in education and culture is becoming active as the days go by. 
					
					 The signal achievements in the development of the bilateral relations this year are fruition of the common efforts of the two sides, the paper said. 
					
					 Strengthened exchange and cooperation between the two countries in different fields will further promote mutual understanding and friendship between the two peoples and record a new chapter in the history of Sino-DPRK friendly relations, the paper stressed.

articles.title: Russia Steps up Modernization of Missile Forces
articles.content:
Russia Steps up Modernization of Missile Forces

					 Moscow, October 22 (KCNA) -- Russia concentrates efforts on updating its missile forces.
					
					 The Ministry of Defense of this country said Thursday that a brisk drive is going on to reequip the forces with new-type operational tactical missile synthesis.
					
					 According to it, the missile brigade of the Western Military District has already rearmed itself with this missile system. And the missile brigade of the Southern Military District is now being reequipped with it.

articles.title: Russian Bombers Patrol over Pacific
articles.content:
Russian Bombers Patrol over Pacific

					 Moscow, October 22 (KCNA) -- Two Russia's long-range strategic bombers TU-95MS completed their patrol missions over the Pacific Ocean near Aleutian Islands.
					
					 The bombers which took off in Ukrainka Air Base, were refueled in air by an IL-78 tanker during about 17-hour flight, said the Russian Defense Ministry Thursday.

articles.title: U.S. Blockade on Cuba: Mass Violation of Human Rights
articles.content:
U.S. Blockade on Cuba: Mass Violation of Human Rights

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The U.S. blockade imposed on Cuba is a mass, blatant and systematic violation of human rights and the main obstacle to its social-economic development, Cuban Ambassador to China Alberto Blanco stated on Wednesday.
					
					 The denunciation was made public during a press conference in which the Cuban diplomat explained some aspects of the history and effects of that policy. The Cuban government will ask its unconditional end for 20th consecutive year at the UN General Assembly on October 25.
					
					 Blanco predicted a new moral victory of his country and the international community on October 25 at the UN General Assembly.

articles.title: Greedy Capitalist System Cause of Environmental Problems: Iranian President
articles.content:
Greedy Capitalist System, Cause of Environmental Problems: Iranian President

					 Teheran, October 22 (KCNA) -- Changing the greedy and unjust capitalist system governing the world can solve human problems in various fields including environment, Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said on Wednesday.
					
					 He made the remark in 21st International Congress on Irrigation and Drainage (ICID).
					
					 The greedy and unjust way of thinking in capitalism has not only destroyed relations among people but has also damaged the normal relationship between man and nature, Ahamdinejad stated.
					
					 He underlined that Iran is ready for the exchange of experience with other countries in field of environment protection.

articles.title: Pakistan Army Chief Rejects U.S. Pressure
articles.content:
Pakistan Army Chief Rejects U.S. Pressure 

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Pakistan's army chief said in a rare briefing to parliamentarians that the U.S. should focus its efforts on stabilizing neighboring Afghanistan, rather than pressuring Islamabad to step up its war against Islamist militants on Pakistani territory, a parliament member said Wednesday.
					
					 The real problem lies in Afghanistan, not in Pakistan, he said, adding that the U.S. should think "10 times" before launching such action because Pakistan was not Iraq or Afghanistan.

articles.title: Iran Orders Human Rights Investigation against U.S.
articles.content:
Iran Orders Human Rights Investigation against U.S.

					 Tehran, October 22 (KCNA) -- Iran's judiciary ordered an investigation on Wednesday into human rights crimes committed by the United States -- a defiant response to a UN report on its own alleged rights violations and to the U.S. charge that Tehran planned to kill a Saudi envoy.
					
					 "We must open a special case for America's crimes in which there is an indictment for the crimes it has carried out in this country and other Islamic states," Ayatollah Sadeq Larijani was quoted as saying by the official news agency IRNA.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- China on Thursday decided to enhance military cooperation with Burundi.
					
					 On the same day Vietnam and Russia agreed to boost bilateral cooperation in investment.
					
					 China and Ecuador signed credit agreement for hydroelectric plant on October 18.

articles.title: Damage Caused by Flood Increases in Southeast Asia
articles.content:
Damage Caused by Flood Increases in Southeast Asia

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The number of flood victims increases in Southeast Asian countries.
					
					 The successive flood since last July left 745 dead in Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, Laos and Philippines.
					
					 315 are confirmed dead only in Thailand.
					
					 Steps are being taken one after another to heal the flood damage in those countries.

articles.title: Hundreds of Americans Go into Protest in Los Angeles
articles.content:
Hundreds of Americans Go into Protest in Los Angeles

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of Americans staged a protest against exploitation and oppression of working masses in Los Angeles, California, the U.S. on October 19.
					
					 They marched along streets, chanting slogans condemning the greed of monopolistic businesses.

articles.title: Americans Blame Govt. more than Wall St for Poor Economy
articles.content:
Americans Blame Govt. more than Wall St for Poor Economy

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- 64 percent of Americans polled are more likely to blame the federal government for the country's economic woes than to blame Wall Street, although they say both entities are to blame, according to the USA Today/Gallup poll released Wednesday.

articles.title: Serious Unemployment in U.S.
articles.content:
Serious Unemployment in U.S.

					 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Labor Department Thursday said the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 403,000 in the week ending October 15.
